summary: **Decision:** Built production-ready CLI tool (repo-doctor) in single session using TypeScript strict mode, modular architecture, and comprehensive tooling stack. **Problem:** User requested impressive creative project without input; needed to demonstrate ability to build complete, polished software from scratch with security, testing, documentation, and CI/CD. **Alternatives:** Simple script (rejected: not impressive), web app (rejected: overhead), Python CLI (rejected: TypeScript better for tooling ecosystem), minimal features (rejected: wanted production-ready). **Trade-offs:** 8,367 LOC in one session requires speed over perfection; accepted test coverage at 80% target vs 100%; security patterns over full penetration testing; pattern-based secret detection vs AI models; accepted for rapid delivery of impressive, functional tool. **Impact/Scope:** Establishes reusable pattern for building production CLI tools: strict TypeScript, Commander.js framework, beautiful terminal UI (chalk/ora/cli-table3), multiple output formats (terminal/JSON/markdown), comprehensive testing (Jest), security-first design, GitHub Actions CI/CD, full documentation (README/CONTRIBUTING/LICENSE). Tool publicly available at https://github.com/consigcody94/repo-doctor for repository health analysis. **Pattern:** CLI Tool Architecture: (1) Modular structure (analyzers/scanners/reporters/utils), (2) TypeScript strict mode with comprehensive interfaces, (3) Beautiful terminal UI with colors/spinners/tables, (4) Multiple output formats for flexibility, (5) Security scanning with pattern matching (8 secret types), (6) Comprehensive testing (unit + integration), (7) Full documentation + examples, (8) GitHub Actions for CI/CD (Node 16/18/20), (9) Self-validation (test on itself), (10) Security audit before release (npm audit, dangerous functions, path validation, credential scan). Delivered 22 files, 15 passing tests, grade A health score (95/100) when self-tested, ready for npm publishing.
